creator: wolfgang.walter@studentenwerk.mhn.de
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Thanks a lot!  Your patch was not quite right since it should just break out of
the loop on EOF: committed for the next release:

http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=155209&view=rev

[Tue Sep 30 09:31:26 2008] [error] [client YYY.YYY.YY.YYY] (70014)End of file found: proxy: error reading status line from remote server XXX.XX.XXX.XXX, referer: https://xx/xx/xx.jsp

We are running apache 2.2.8 on windows 2003.
Received this error today in a situation to download a large file. There may be possibility the file has some end-of-file characters but Apache is not supposed to treat it as bad_response, based on what I have read in this bug history.

Is this fixed in the later versions?
creator: karthikramas@gmail.com

text:
At best your case is a duplicate of PR37770. Please notice the different error messages from the reporter and your error message:

Reporter:

proxy: error reading response

You

error reading status line from remote server

The error message means that your backend does not even bother to sent a HTTP status, but just closes the connection without sending *anything*. This an error of the backend not of httpd.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
